resources.string:
This is the list of plugins currently integrated in Printoid.

All OctoPrint's plugin are not implemented in Printoid and I (the developer) can not integrated them all.

Please contact me at contact@printoid.net if you would like to see a new plugin in Printoid. I will reflect on its integration (if and only it is possible).
This OctoPrint plugin controls an ATX/AUX power supply to help reduce power consumption and noise when the printer is not in use.
Plugin for automatically shutting down the system after print is finished. Can be configured only when the server is up.
Work inspired by OctoPrint-PSUControl and TP-Link WiFi SmartPlug Client, this plugin controls a TP-Link Smartplug via OctoPrint\'s nav bar.
This plugin allows for the control of Belkin Wemo devices via navbar buttons and gcode commands.
This plugin controls Tuya-based SmartPlugs. Work based on OctoPrint-TPLinkSmartplug and python-tuya.
Control pretty much everything that you might want to do on your Raspberry Pi/OctoPrint/Enclosure.
Display temperatures on OctoPrint\'s navigation bar. For Raspberry Pi users, this plugin allows to show the Raspberry Pi\'s CPU temperature in the app title bar automatically.
This plugin is used by Printoid to get the current fan speed and update the slider accordingly.

Octolapse is designed to make stabilized timelapses of your prints with as little hassle as possible, and it\'s extremely configurable. Now you can create a silky smooth timelapse without a custom camera mount, no GCode customizations required.

This plugin will extract the embedded thumbnails from PrusaSlicer gcode files where the printer\'s profile ini file has the thumbnail option configured. This is default behavior for the Prusa Mini printer profile.
This plugin adds support for Ultimaker Format Package (.ufp) files. Ultimaker Format Package files are based on Open Packaging Conventions (OPC) and contain compressed gcode and a preview thumbnail.
Printoid Plugin for OctoPrint to receive push notifications in real time about your print status and more, even when the app is in background.
This plugin is to control ITead Sonoff devices that have been flashed with Sonoff-Tasmota via web calls.
The PSU Control plugin shall be installed on your OctoPrint server. Then it will automatically appear in the left menu of the app.
The TP-Link SmartPlug shall be installed on your OctoPrint server. Then it will automatically appear in the left menu of the app.
The Tasmota plugin shall be installed on your OctoPrint server. Then it will automatically appear in the left menu of the app.
The WemoSwitch plugin shall be installed on your OctoPrint server. Then it will automatically appear in the left menu of the app.
The Tuya SmartPlug plugin shall be installed on your OctoPrint server. Then it will automatically appear in the left menu of the app.
This plugin will be integrated very soon in Printoid, please be patient :) You will be informed once available.
The Navbar Temp plugin shall be installed on your OctoPrint server.\n\nThen if you are using a Raspberry Pi, its CPU temperature will appear automatically in the app\'s title bar.
This plugin seems not available (or not installed on your OctoPrint server). Please check its status on your OctoPrint server\'s settings.
This plugin is not available in this version of Printoid. Please consider upgrading Printoid to enjoy this feature in the app! (check on https://printoid.net the available plugins per version)
The Printoid Plugin is installed on your OctoPrint server
The Printoid Plugin seems not installed on your OctoPrint server, please install it and pair it with your device to enjoy real time notifications.
Select the layers you want to be notified for when it starts to be printed (requires DisplayLayerProgress plugin to be installed)
Failed to get the list of layers to be notified for
Layer added successfully, you will receive a notification when reached!
Failed to add layer to the list of notifications
Layer removed successfully, you will stop receiving notification for this one!
Failed to remove layer from the list of notifications
Mute the Prusa Multi Material Upgrade (MMU) notifications when it requires user assistance, for the given duration (in minutes)
MMU events snoozed for the next %d minutes
Select which progress to be notified for, when it is reached by the current job
Manage the notifications settings (define specific sounds and vibrations for every available channels)
Notifications on heated head cool down
When extruder temperature falls below this threshold once print completed, OctoPrint will send you a notification.
Heated head trigger value for temperature notification set to %d
Failed to set heated head trigger value for temperature notification!
Notifications on heated bed cool down
When bed temperature falls below this threshold once print completed, OctoPrint will send you a notification.
Heated bed trigger value for temperature notification set to %d
Failed to set heated bed trigger value for temperature notification!
When bed warms up to the target temperature for the following duration before print starts, OctoPrint will send you a notification
Heated bed warm duration set to %d minutes
Failed to set heated bed warm duration

When current print job was paused waiting for user, OctoPrint will send notification. Useful when running out of filament or need to change color of filament (M600). The following setting controls the frequency notifications will be sent. A low number might end up spamming user. A value of 0 will disable this type of notifications
Failed to set thermal protection parameters

When current print job was paused waiting for user, OctoPrint will send notification. Useful when running out of filament or need to change color of filament (M600). The following setting controls the frequency notifications will be sent. A low number might end up spamming user. A value of 0 will disable this type of notifications
Printer paused notification delay set to %d minutes
Failed to set printer paused notification delay
When SoC temperature goes above threshold, OctoPrint will send notification. New single-board computers like RPi 4 tend to run hot. A value of 0 will disable the notifications below.
Failed to set SoC temperature threshold
